attributes.action: UK government should provide visa facilities in Afghanistan.
attributes.background: UK government should provide visa facilities in Afghanistan for allBritish Afghan to make an application apply for spouse visa,  settlement visa, students visa  and visit visa in Afghanistan. UK government does not provide visa facilities In Afghanistan.
attributes.additional_details:
It's very difficult for every Afghans have to travel to the nearest countries Pakistan or India to apply for visa, their passports gets submitted and they get stuck without passport for minimum few months.
Most of the visa applications are family settlement, spouse visa, where someone has to travel with them most probably husband from the UK. Financial costs are huge, Around £9000.00 easy to spend and also with out job for few months until get back to UK.

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Require all schools to provide a trouser alternative during summer periods.
attributes.background: All schools should be legally obliged to provide all students with a trouser alternative; although traditionally formal customs be respected, it is ridiculous that many individuals are not provided with alternative uniforms options, such as shorts, during hotter summer periods.
attributes.additional_details: Many schools throughout the country simply do not provide students with uniform alternatives for hotter weather periods, as a result thousands of students find it particularly hard to concentrate are learn effectively during their academic experience. Being forced to overheat due to schools not providing cooler uniform alternatives is patently absurd - as such, all schools most make a summer suitable uniform for their students.

attributes.action: Make causing a psychological injury (mental illness) a criminal offence.
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to make it a crime to intentionally or recklessly cause unnecessary psychological injury to another; add mental illness to the list of reportable injuries in relation to work; and ensure that the cause of any illness that leads to a suicide is fully investigated.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people suffers a mental illness during their lifetime.
Sometimes this is directly attributable to the behaviour of another or others.  In these cases the only legal remedy is a personal injury claim which lacks personal accountability and doesn't encourage improved behaviour.
In addition, psychological injuries don't currently have to be reported to the Health and Safety Executive so are not monitored.
Mental abuse is serious and should be given the same importance as physical abuse.

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Make it standard at your 12 week fetal scan that your cervix is also measured
attributes.background: I am currently 23 weeks pregnant.I had my 20 week scan last week.Due to current testing at my hospital they also measured my cervix(which isn't standard practice).My cervix was measuring 6mm instead of approx.4cm.This may have been picked up on previous scan earlier on and prevented such a high risk
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 20 pregnancies experience shortening of the cervix which may lead to late miscarriage or preterm labour. The sooner this is found, the more time hospitals have to try and prevent the cervix getting worse.

attributes.action: Allow store loyalty card schemes to award points on the purchase of baby formula
attributes.background:
The law as it stands prohibits stores from issuing loyalty card points on the sale of baby milk formula. Parents are barred from amassing points to make savings.

This is unfair to parents who don't always have a choice in using formula. Also to parents exercising their right to choose not to.
attributes.additional_details:
The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula (England) Regulations 2007 (section 23) prohibits marketing of baby formula. Loyalty card schemes are being caught up in this, barring parents from accruing points and making savings. 

The purchase is being made regardless, without promotional inducement. The collection of points by parents cannot be called marketing.

The legislation can be found here

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2007/3521/regulation/23/made

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
attributes.background: Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.

This means employers can force people to immediately return to work or go unpaid/use their holiday, which is unacceptable & counter-productive for well-being.

attributes.action: The government need to put more money into road signs and cameras
attributes.background: I would like more things put in place to protect people not just on the moterways but on our streets and roads where we live. More money should be put into advanced technology for catching people speeding, like cameras on our roads, because they cost a lot it's very hard to get one on our streets.

attributes.action: Transition the United Kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics
attributes.background: Abolish the monarchy and reform the United kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics

attributes.action: Make it a UK law for premises selling food or drink to hold EpiPens
attributes.background: Allergies are on the rise in the UK and there are an increasing amount of stories of people who have suffered severely or even died from the unawareness and ignorance surrounding food allergies. Many cases of anaphylaxis could be prevented if epipens were provided by food and drink establishments
attributes.additional_details: There have been many cases where a second EpiPen has been needed to treat an anaphylaxis shock. If food establishments were to hold EpiPens for consumers with allergies they could prevent serious illness and in some cases death. It is understandable that EpiPens can't just be handed out to any member of the public so I propose that allergy sufferers carry a card with them, provided by the NHS to state that they have a serious allergy and can be administered with an EpiPen.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Change the curriculum to provide greater mental health support in education.
attributes.background:
bangthedesk.com is campaigning to change the curriculum and reform the education system.

Suicide is the leading cause of death among young people in the UK; this peaks in exam season.

We can statistically prove the damaging affect of stress on young people, so why are we doing nothing to help?
attributes.additional_details:
Bang The Desk is petitioning the government to make the following changes to the UK school curriculum:

1. Remove formal testing for anyone under the age of 18.

2. Increase funding for the arts. 
​
3. Introduce an hour of wellbeing into the curriculum every day.

4. Start and end every school day with 10 minutes of mindfulness.

5. Greater mental health support across all educational institutions; mandatory counselling once a month for every student.
​
6. Better wages and support for teachers.

attributes.action: Yemen: Call for ceasefire and support 6-point pledge to end conflict and famine
attributes.background:
With 85k children perished so far and 8m people on verge of starvation, the UK must act to protect the people of Yemen.
The government must call for a ceasefire, the adoption of a new UN Security Council resolution, proper funding of humanitarian relief, and investigation of alleged war crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
The six point pledge was drawn up by NGOs, politicians and members of the UN.

http://blog.handicap-international.org/influenceandethics/2018/11/12/alert-35-organizations-call-for-immediate-cessation-of-hostilities-in-yemen/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/nov/22/famine-yemen-war-crime-civilians-saudi-coalition

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/yemen-war-latest-news-starving-save-the-children-yemeni-famine-a8643906.html

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Make on-line gambling illegal
attributes.background: 24-hour easy access to on-line gambling exacerbates the tragic results of people gambling beyond their means. Ban it completely, by making on-line gambling illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details: The well-publicised explosion in on-line gambling illustrates how vast fortunes are made by small numbers of owners, at the expense of huge numbers of vulnerable gamblers, including the young and those who can ill afford to spend on gambling. Gambling profits come from one single source: the gamblers' losses. It causes hardship, family rifts, depression and suicides. On-line gambling specifically presents easy opportunities 24/7/365 for people to succumb to temptation to bet beyond their means, without even leaving their homes, and without regard for consequences. There is only one effective solution, which is to ban on-line gambling completely, by making it illegal in the UK

attributes.action: Introduce a climate change levy on beef and dairy products
attributes.background:
The livestock sector has overshot safe limits and in particular dairy and beef production have been identified as major contributors to climate change and biodiversity loss.

Also over-consumption of these products is a fact of our unhealthy lifestyles, giving us obesity and coronary heart disease
attributes.additional_details:
A levy on these products will increase Treasury funds whilst making us more healthy whilst helping us achieve emissions targets. A win-win situation, that might also yield a reduction in the burden on the NHS similar to that brought about by reduction in smoking.

Tax receipts could be used incentivise livestock farmers to turn foresters, turning their land over for reforestation which would improve biodiversity and local air quality and allow our countryside to return to its natural state.

attributes.action: Change Planning Laws on Fences to require a 300mm Hole on each side for Wildlife
attributes.background: Today most New Houses have FULLY enclosed rear gardens with high fences down to the ground, seeing our Wildlife is in Decline it makes sense to help them out with these Holes so they can Roam around as they should, Humans have and keep taking away their Habitat, Hedgehogs for one do a lot of good.
attributes.additional_details:
Concrete Gravel Boards need to have one Manufactured with a Hole, wooden fences need the same when sat on the ground, Humans must try to Protect Wildlife for future Generations or we are Selfish.
 
Please Support this as our Wildlife would Appreciate it.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be sold in registered gun shops
attributes.background:
Restrict the sale of fireworks to just registered gun dealers. Gun dealers are competent and qualified in firearms and ammunition so are certainly the right people for judging whom they sell too.
 This will prevent fireworks from falling into the hands of youths and the wrong people.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Fund overnight hostels for homeless people in each town and city
attributes.background: I wish for this to happen because homeless people are not treated fairly in today’s society and wish to show people that everyone is equal.
attributes.additional_details: If people are living on the streets then it could cause more health condition and cost more money for the NHS which is already struggling as quite clearly proven

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Ban cot bumpers and baby sleeping aids from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Every year babies die in cots where parents use bumpers and positional sleeping aids. These deaths are unnecessary and many are avoidable. 

The recommendations for safe sleep do not include these items and many parents are misinformed in the safety of these.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.
